intro: Lipochaeta lobata subsp. lobata, commonly known as the hairy goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is typically found in grasslands and open habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in composite clusters. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
